title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 334.2 - Chair and presiding officer
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 334.2 - Chair and presiding officer

State Regulations

The chief administrative officer of the college shall be
the chair of the faculty of each college. Each college faculty may provide for
the selection of its presiding officer, in a manner to be specified in college
faculty bylaws. Both the chancellor and the chief administrative officer shall
be empowered to call meetings of the college faculty or the governance body of
that faculty and of its executive committee. The agendum of each meeting of
these bodies shall provide, as a priority order of business, an opportunity for
both the chancellor and chief administrative officer to present their
reports. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
334.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
